game_description: Full version releasing June 1! Work together with yourself in VR! We Are One Demo is a puzzle shooter where you solve mind-bending puzzles by cloning yourself and playing with time loops. Cleverly plan ahead and cooperate with your own clones - the only help you really need (and get) is yourself! “We Are One Demo” in a nutshell: *All your teammates are You. If you want something done right do it yourself! *Big-brain puzzles meet action-packed shooter elements *Experience a variety of levels with increasing challenges and new twists for you to overcome in your OWN way! *A unique art style, where watercolor textures meet digitally drawn lines and moody vibes! *Perfect for VR beginners and experienced users - It's easy to pick up, but challenging to master! *No artificial locomotion and only teleportation is used We are actively working on a paid full version with a story and more content! A level editor will be included in the full game in a later update. Previously known as "Help Yourself"
review_1: This game was super fun I would so get the full release when it comes out unless it cost a lot that is the only thing that might bring this game down when it comes out. Overall though i love the gimmick where you gotta work with the other you its super cool definitely gonna play this on the real release
review_2: At first, I was a little skeptical about the game, however as soon as I started playing, I was totally shocked and amazed. The concept of this game is just so creative and unique. The gameplay itself felt smooth too and I had a blast playing it. Even though this demo is short, I still had such a great time. Getting a faster time each attempt is just pure excitement. I will definitely be buying the full game when it comes out. Can't wait!
review_3: First game I put my mom in to she hadn't played vr before so I thought this game would be great and it was she loved it please add multi-player it would make the game 10 times better
review_5: Euh you gave to reprogram your mind to find a solution or do some time travel it is all posible in vr Also I'm left handed and many game stucks when I use my left hand but here if gave not to change anythings it works perfect Also a strange world with drawer object but why not in a vr world Keep going can't wait to see more
